decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while drawing cards and maintaining control of the board. The deck utilizes powerful planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset to control the game and limit the opponent's options. It also includes powerful instant-speed removal like Swords to Plowshares and Supreme Verdict to deal with threats. The deck is designed to outvalue the opponent and win through attrition and control of the game.

The main focus of this Goblins deck is to quickly overwhelm the opponent with a swarm of aggressive creatures, leveraging cards that provide explosive mana acceleration like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The Goblins in the deck have synergy with each other, along with cards like Battle Cry Goblin to boost their attacking power. The land base is optimized to support the aggressive strategy, with City of Traitors and Ancient Tomb providing additional mana acceleration.

This Grixis Control deck focuses on controlling the opponent's board and resources using a combination of removal spells, counterspells, and disruptive creatures like Orcish Bowmasters. The deck also features powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Narset, Parter of Veils to generate card advantage and disrupt the opponent's game plan. In addition, the deck incorporates versatile spells like Cling to Dust and Thoughtseize to interact with the opponent's graveyard and hand, respectively. The ultimate goal is to outvalue the opponent and gradually grind them out of the game.

The main idea of this deck is to assemble the combo of Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a 20/20 Marit Lage token in order to win the game quickly. This is supported by disruption spells like Duress, Thoughtseize, and Grief to control the opponent's strategy, as well as acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Elvish Spirit Guide to quickly set up the combo. Crop Rotation and Once Upon a Time help find the needed combo pieces, while lands like Urborg, Tomb of Yawgmoth and Bojuka Bog provide additional utility.

This deck focuses on quickly generating mana and card advantage to set up a powerful combo turn using cards like Dark Ritual, Lion's Eye Diamond, and Infernal Tutor. By carefully sequencing your spells and utilizing cards like Duress and Thoughtseize to disrupt your opponent's game plan, you can set up a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam win condition. The inclusion of Wishclaw Talisman and Burning Wish provides additional flexibility in finding key combo pieces when needed. Overall, the deck aims to create a storm of spells to overwhelm your opponent and win the game in a single explosive turn.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling combos using cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker. It utilizes Goblin Engineer and Goblin Welder to find and recur key pieces while also having access to powerful artifacts like Mox Opal and Shadowspear. The deck also has a touch of disruption with cards like Lightning Bolt and Nihil Spellbomb. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a combination of disruptive elements and explosive combos, ultimately aiming to win the game through a well-timed sequence of plays.
